member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRBackend
member.summary: Possible 3D APIs that may be used by Ganesh.

member.summary: Use the OpenGL 3D backend.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRBackend.Vulkan
member.summary: Use the Vulkan 3D backend.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc
member.summary: Wrap an existing render target created by the client in the 3D API with an underlying GRRenderTarget object.

remarks.para: The client is responsible for ensuring that the underlying 3D API object lives at least as long as the GRRenderTarget object wrapping it.

We require the client to explicitly provide information about the target, such as width, height, and pixel config rather than querying the 3D API for these values. We expect these properties to be immutable even if the 3D API doesn't require this (OpenGL).

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.Config
member.summary: Gets or sets the color format.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the pixel origin.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.Rect
member.summary: Gets a rectangle with the current width and height.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.RenderTargetHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets the handle to the 3D API object.
member.remarks: When using OpenGL, it is the FBO ID.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.SampleCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of samples per pixel.
member.remarks: This is used to influence decisions about applying other forms of anti-aliasing.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.Size
member.summary: Gets the current size of the 3D API object.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.StencilBits
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of bits of stencil per-pixel.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendRenderTargetDesc.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width in pixels.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRBackendState.None
member.summary: Reset nothing.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc
member.summary: Wrap an existing texture created by the client in the 3D API with an underlying GRTexture object.

remarks.para: The client is responsible for ensuring that the texture lives at least as long as the GrTexture object wrapping it.

We require the client to explicitly provide information about the texture, such as width, height, and pixel config, rather than querying the 3D API for these values. We expect these to be immutable even if the 3D API doesn't require this (OpenGL).
Textures that are also render targets are supported as well. Any ancillary 3D API (stencil buffer, FBO id, etc) objects necessary will be managed.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc.Config
member.summary: Gets or sets the color format.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc.Flags
member.summary: Gets or sets additional options about the texture.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height in pixels.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the pixel origin.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc.SampleCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of samples per pixel.
member.remarks: If the render target flag is set and sample count is greater than 0, then an MSAA buffer that resolves to the texture will be created.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc.TextureHandle
member.summary: Gets or sets the handle to the 3D API object.
member.remarks: When using OpenGL, it is the Texture ID.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDesc.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width in pixels.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDescFlags
member.summary: Additional options for a backend texture.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDescFlags.None
member.summary: No flags enabled.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRBackendTextureDescFlags.RenderTarget
member.summary: Indicates that the texture is also a render target.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.GRContext.AbandonContext(System.Boolean)
member.param: Use true to indicate that the underlying 3D context is not yet lost and the will cleanup all allocated resources before returning. Using false will ensure that the destructors of the and any of its created resource objects will not make backend 3D API calls.
member.summary: Abandons all GPU resources and assumes the underlying backend 3D API context is not longer usable. After returning it will assume that the underlying context may no longer be valid.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.GRContext.ResetContext(SkiaSharp.GRBackendState)
member.param: Flags to control what is reset.
member.summary: Informs the context that the state was modified and should resend.
member.remarks: The context normally assumes that no outsider is setting state within the underlying 3D API's context/device/whatever. This method shouldn’t be called frequently for good performance.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.GRContext.SetResourceCacheLimits(System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.param: The maximum number of resources that can be held in the cache.
The maximum number of bytes of video memory that can be held in the cache.
member.summary: Specify the GPU resource cache limits.
member.remarks: If the current cache exceeds either of these, it will be purged (LRU) to keep the cache within these limits.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRContextFlushBits.Discard
member.summary: A client may reach a point where it has partially rendered a frame through a GRContext that it knows the user will never see. This flag causes the flush to skip submission of deferred content to the 3D API during the flush.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.GRContextFlushBits.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions
member.summary: Represents the collection of options for the construction of a context.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.AllowPathMaskCaching
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow path mask textures to be cached.
member.remarks: This is only really useful if paths are commonly rendered at the same scale and fractional translation. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.AvoidStencilBuffers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to avoid allocating stencil buffers.
member.remarks: Bugs on certain drivers cause stencil buffers to leak. This flag causes Skia to avoid allocating stencil buffers and use alternate rasterization paths, avoiding the leak.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.BufferMapThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold, in bytes, above which a buffer mapping API will be used to map vertex and index buffers to CPU memory in order to update them.
member.remarks: A value of -1 means the context should deduce the optimal value for this platform. Default is -1.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.ClipBatchToBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to turn each batch bounds into a clip rect.
member.remarks: For debugging purposes. This is used to verify that the clip bounds are conservative. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.ClipDrawOpsToBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to turn each draw operation's bounds into a clip rectangle.
member.remarks: For debugging purposes. This is used to verify that the clip bounds are conservative. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.Default
member.summary: Gets a new instance with the values set to the defaults.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.DisableDistanceFieldPaths
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to disable distance field rendering for paths.
member.remarks: Distance field computation can be expensive and yields no benefit if a path is not rendered multiple times with different transforms. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.DisableGpuYuvConversion
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the GPU will be used to perform YUV -> RGB conversion when generating textures from codec-backed images.
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.DoManualMipmapping
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to construct mipmaps manually, via repeated downsampling draw-calls.
member.remarks: This is used when the driver's implementation (glGenerateMipmap) contains bugs. This requires mipmap level and LOD control (ie desktop or ES3). Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.DrawBatchBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to draw a wireframe device bounds rect for each batch.
member.remarks: For debugging purposes. The wireframe rect is drawn before the batch in order to visualize batches that draw outside of their dev bounds. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.EnableInstancedRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable instanced rendering as long as all required functionality is supported by the hardware.
member.remarks: Instanced rendering is still experimental at this point and disabled by default. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.ForceSWPathMasks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to force all path draws to go through through the software-rasterize-to-texture code path.
member.remarks: This assumes the path is not recognized as a simpler shape (e.g. a rrect). This is intended for testing purposes. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.GpuPathRenderers
member.summary: Gets or sets the GPU path renderers.
member.remarks: Default is .

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.ImmediateMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the context operates in immediate mode.
member.remarks: The context will issue all draws to the backend API immediately. Intended to ease debugging. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.MaxBatchLookahead
member.summary: Gets or sets a value overriding the default maximum look-ahead window for batch combing.
member.remarks: For debugging purposes. Default is -1.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.MaxBatchLookback
member.summary: Gets or sets a value overriding the default maximum look-back window for batch combing.
member.remarks: For debugging purposes. Default is -1.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.MaxOpCombineLookahead
member.summary: Gets or sets a value overriding the default maximum look-ahead window for operation combing.
member.remarks: For debugging purposes. Default is -1.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.MaxOpCombineLookback
member.summary: Gets or sets a value overriding the default maximum look-back window for operation combing.
member.remarks: For debugging purposes. Default is -1.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.MaxTextureSizeOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of a texture.
member.remarks: An option to override feature detection using backend API queries. The override can only reduce the feature set or limits, never increase them beyond the detected values. Default is 0x7FFFFFFF.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.MaxTileSizeOverride
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size (if non-zero) of a tile for software-backed images and bitmaps rendered by the device.
member.remarks: An option to override feature detection using backend API queries. The override can only reduce the feature set or limits, never increase them beyond the detected values. Default is 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.RequireDecodeDisableForSrgb
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether sRGB support will be disabled if sRGB decoding cannot be enabled.
member.remarks: Default is true.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.SuppressDualSourceBlending
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to suppress dual source blending.
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.SuppressPathRendering
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the caps will never report driver support for path rendering.
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.SuppressPrints
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to suppress prints for the .
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.UseDrawInsteadOfPartialRenderTargetWrite
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to avoid partial writes.
member.remarks: Some GPUs have problems with partial writes of the render target. Default is false.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.GRContextOptions.UseShaderSwizzling
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to do all swizzling manually in the shader and don't rely on extensions to do swizzling.
member.remarks: Default is false.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType
member.summary: Describes how to interpret the alpha component of a pixel.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKAlphaType.Opaque
member.summary: All pixels are stored as opaque.

summary.para: All pixels have their alpha premultiplied in their color components.
This is the natural format for the rendering target pixels.
All pixels have their color components stored without any regard to the alpha. e.g. this is the default configuration for PNG images.
This alpha-type is ONLY supported for input images. Rendering cannot generate this on output.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap
member.summary: The specifies a raster bitmap.

remarks.para: A bitmap has an integer width and height, and a format (colortype), and a pointer to the actual pixels. Bitmaps can be drawn into a , but they are also used to specify the target of a ' drawing operations.

A exposes , which lets a caller write its pixels. To retrieve a pointer to the raw image data of the bitmap, call the method, and then call the method to get a pointer to the image data. Once you no longer need to use the raw data pointer, call the method. The raw data is laid out in the format configured at the time that the bitmap was created.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKBitmap.SetImmutable
member.summary: Marks the bitmap as immutable.
member.remarks: Marks this bitmap as immutable, meaning that the contents of its pixels will not change for the lifetime of the bitmap and of the underlying pixelref. This state can be set, but it cannot be cleared once it is set. This state propagates to all other bitmaps that share the same pixelref.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode
member.summary: Pre-defined blend modes.

remarks.para: Porter Duff Compositing Operators - defined algebra of compositing. These operators control the results of mixing the four sub-pixel regions formed by the overlapping of graphical objects that have an alpha or pixel coverage channel/value.
Separable Blend Mode - each component of the result color is completely determined by the corresponding components of the constituent backdrop and source colors.
Non-Separable Blend Mode - considers all color components in combination as opposed to the separable ones that look at each component individually.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Clear
member.summary: No regions are enabled. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_clr.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Dst
member.summary: Only the destination will be present. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.DstATop
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source replaces the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-atop.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.DstIn
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source, replaces the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-in.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.DstOut
member.summary: Destination is placed, where it falls outside of the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-out.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.DstOver
member.summary: Destination is placed over the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-over.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Modulate
member.summary: Multiplies all components (= alpha and color). [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Plus
member.summary: Display the sum of the source image and destination image. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKBlendMode.Src
member.summary: Only the source will be present. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src.svg)

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas
member.summary: Encapsulates all of the state about drawing into a device (bitmap).

remarks.para: Encapsulates all of the state about drawing into a device (bitmap).

This includes a reference to the device itself, and a stack of matrix/clip values. For any given draw call (e.g. drawRect), the geometry of the object being drawn is transformed by the concatenation of all the matrices in the stack. The transformed geometry is clipped by the intersection of all of the clips in the stack.

While the canvas holds the state of the drawing device, the state (style) of the object being drawn is held by the Paint, which is provided as a parameter to each of the draw() methods. The Paint holds attributes such as color, typeface, the text size, the stroke width, the shader (for example, gradients, patterns), etc.
The SKCanvas is returned when accessing the property of a surface.
Transformations
The supports a number of 2D transformations. Unlike other 2D graphic systems like CoreGraphics or Cairo, SKCanvas extends the transformations to include perspectives.
You can use the , , , , to perform some of the most common 2D transformations.
For more control you can use the to set an arbitrary transformation using the and the to concatenate an transformation to the current matrix in use.
The can be used to reset the state of the matrix
Drawing
The drawing operations can take a parameter to affect their drawing. You use objects to cache the style and color information to draw geometries, texts and bitmaps.
Clipping Path
State

It is possible to save the current transformations by calling the method which preserves the current transformation matrix, you can then alter the matrix and restore the previous state by using the or methods.

Additionally, it is possible to push a new state with which will make an offscreen copy of a region, and once the drawing is completed, calling the method which copies the offscreen bitmap into this canvas.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.DrawPoints(SkiaSharp.SKPointMode,SkiaSharp.SKPoint[],SkiaSharp.SKPaint)
member.param: Determines how the points array will be interpreted: as points, as coordinates to draw lines, or as coordinates of a polygon.
The array of points to draw.
The paint to use when drawing the points.
member.summary: Draws an array of points, lines or a polygon in the canvas, one at a time.

remarks.para: For , each point is drawn centered at its coordinate, and its size is specified by the paint's stroke-width. It draws as a square, unless the paint's is , in which the points are drawn as circles.
For , each pair of points is drawn as a line segment, respecting the paint's settings for cap, join and width.
For , the entire array is drawn as a series of connected line segments.

Note that, while similar, the line and polygon modes draw slightly differently than the equivalent path built with a series of move to, line to calls, in that the path will draw all of its contours at once, with no interactions if contours intersect each other (think ).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.QuickReject(SkiaSharp.SKPath)
member.param: The path to compare with the current clip.
member.summary: Checks to see if the specified path, after being transformed by the current matrix, would lie completely outside of the current clip.
member.returns: Returns true if the path (transformed by the canvas' matrix) does not intersect with the canvas’ clip.
member.remarks: Call this to check if an area you intend to draw into is clipped out (and therefore you can skip making the draw calls).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.ResetMatrix
member.summary: Sets the current matrix to identity.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Restore
member.summary: Restore the canvas state.
member.remarks: This call balances a previous call to , and is used to remove all modifications to the matrix, clip and draw filter state since the last save call. It is an error to restore more times than was previously saved.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.RestoreToCount(System.Int32)
member.param: The number of levels to restore from, or -1 to restore all the way back to the initial value.
member.summary: Efficiently restores the state to a specific level.
member.remarks: Efficient way to pop any calls to that happened after the save count reached . It is an error for to be greater than . To pop all the way back to the initial matrix/clip context set count to -1.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.Save
member.summary: Saves the canvas state.
member.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.
member.remarks: This call saves the current matrix, clip, and draw filter, and pushes a copy onto a private stack. Subsequent calls to translate, scale, rotate, skew, concat or clipping path or drawing filter all operate on this copy. When the balancing call to is made, the previous matrix, clipping, and drawing filters are restored.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.SaveCount
member.summary: Gets the number of matrix/clip states on the canvas' private stack.
member.remarks: This will equal the number of calls minus calls + 1. The save count on a new canvas is 1.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.SaveLayer(SkiaSharp.SKPaint)
member.param: This is copied, and is applied to the offscreen when is called.
member.summary: Saves the canvas state and allocates an offscreen bitmap.
member.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.
member.remarks: This behaves the same as but in addition it allocates an offscreen bitmap. All drawing calls are directed there, and only when the balancing call to is made is that offscreen transfered to the canvas (or the previous layer).

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKCanvas.SaveLayer(SkiaSharp.SKRect,SkiaSharp.SKPaint)
member.param: This clipping rectangle hint to limit the size of the offscreen bitmap.
This is copied, and is applied to the offscreen when is called.
member.summary: Saves the canvas state and allocates an offscreen bitmap.
member.returns: The value to pass to to balance this save.

remarks.para: This behaves the same as but in addition it allocates an offscreen bitmap. All drawing calls are directed there, and only when the balancing call to is made is that offscreen transfered to the canvas (or the previous layer).

The limit rectangle, is used as a hint to limit the size of the offscreen bitmap, and thus drawing may be clipped to it, though that clipping is not guaranteed to happen. If exact clipping is desired, use .

If the spcified size is different from the size from , then the codec will attempt to scale the resulting bitmap. If the codec cannot perform this scale, this method will return .

If specified color type is , then the caller must provide a color table array, with a length of at least 256. On success, the codec will copy the colors into that storage, and set colorTableCount to the logical number of table entries.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKColorFilter.CreateGamma(System.Single)

member.summary: Creates a new gamma color filter which can be used to perform pixel-by-pixel conversion between linear and power-law color spaces.
member.returns: Returns the new .
member.remarks: A gamma of 2.2 is interpreted to mean convert from sRGB to linear while a gamma of 1/2.2 is interpreted to mean convert from linear to sRGB. Any other values are just directly applied (i.e., out = in ^ gamma).

member.summary: The transfer function is linear.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKColorSpaceRenderTargetGamma.Srgb
member.summary: The transfer function is the canonical sRGB curve, which has a short linear segment followed by a 2.4f exponential.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKColorSpaceTransferFn
member.summary: Represents the coefficients for a common transfer function equation.

remarks.para: The coefficients are specified as a transformation from a curved space to linear.
LinearVal = C*InputVal + F; (for 0.0f <= InputVal < D)
LinearVal = (A*InputVal + B)^G + E; (forD <= InputVal <= 1.0f)
Function is undefined if InputVal is not in [ 0.0f, 1.0f ].
Resulting LinearVals must be in [ 0.0f, 1.0f ].
Function must be positive and increasing.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKData
member.summary: The holds an immutable data buffer.

remarks.para: Not only is the data immutable, but the actual pointer that is returned by the property is guaranteed to always be the same for the life of this instance.
The method can be used to return a that wraps this and allows for .NET APIs to scan the contents of the as a stream.
You can use the constructors for this object to make copies of the data, or you can use the to wrap a block of memory that has been allocated with the platform “malloc" function.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKFontManager.MatchCharacter(System.String,System.String[],System.Char)
member.param: The family name to use when searching.
The ISO 639, 15924, and 3166-1 code to use when searching, such as “ja” and “zh”.
The character to find a typeface for.
member.summary: Use the system fallback to find a typeface for the given character.
member.returns: Returns the that containes the given character, or if none was found.
member.remarks: Note that is a combination of ISO 639, 15924, and 3166-1 codes, so it is fine to just pass a ISO 639 here. The first item is the least significant fallback, and the last is the most significant. If no specified codes match, any font with the requested character will be matched.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics
member.summary: Structure to represent measurements for a font.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.Ascent
member.summary: Gets the recommended distance above the baseline.
member.remarks: Will be <= 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.AverageCharacterWidth
member.summary: Gets the average character width.
member.remarks: Will be >= 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.Bottom
member.summary: Gets the greatest distance below the baseline for any glyph.
member.remarks: Will be >= 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.CapHeight
member.summary: Gets the cap height.
member.remarks: Will be > 0, or 0 if cannot be determined.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.Descent
member.summary: Gets the recommended distance below the baseline.
member.remarks: Will be >= 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.Leading
member.summary: Gets the recommended distance to add between lines of text.
member.remarks: Will be >= 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.MaxCharacterWidth
member.summary: Gets the max character width.
member.remarks: Will be >= 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.Top
member.summary: Gets the greatest distance above the baseline for any glyph.
member.remarks: Will be <= 0.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.UnderlinePosition
member.summary: Gets tosition of the top of the underline stroke relative to the baseline.

remarks.para: Negative - underline should be drawn above baseline.
Positive - underline should be drawn below baseline.
Zero - underline should be drawn on baseline.underline position, or 0 if cannot be determined.
null - does not have an UnderlinePosition.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.UnderlineThickness
member.summary: Gets the thickness of the underline.

remarks.para: 0 - if the thickness can not be determined
null - if the thickness is not set.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.XHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of an 'x' in px.
member.remarks: 0 if no 'x' in face.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.XMax
member.summary: Gets the maximum bounding box x value for all glyphs.

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKFontMetrics.XMin
member.summary: Gets the minimum bounding box x value for all glyphs.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKImage
member.summary: An abstraction for drawing a rectangle of pixels.

remarks.para: An image is an abstraction of pixels, though the particular type of image could be actually storing its data on the GPU, or as drawing commands (picture or PDF or otherwise), ready to be played back into another canvas.
The content of an image is always immutable, though the actual storage may change, if for example that image can be re-created via encoded data or other means.
An image always has a non-zero dimensions. If there is a request to create a new image, either directly or via a surface, and either of the requested dimensions are zero, then will be returned.

member.summary: Applies a given image filter to this image, and return the filtered result.

member.param: The region to sample.

The maximum alpha for pixels outside the region.
The input filter to use.
member.summary: Creates an image filter that samples a region.
member.returns: Returns the new , or null on error.
member.remarks: If the sample is inside the region the alpha of the image is boosted up to a threshold value. If it is outside the region then the alpha is decreased to the threshold value. The (0, 0) point of the region corresponds to the upper left corner of the source image.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKPaint
member.summary: Holds the style and color information about how to draw geometries, text and bitmaps.

remarks.para: Anytime you draw something in SkiaSharp, and want to specify what color it is, or how it blends with the background, or what style or font to draw it in, you specify those attributes in a paint.

Unlike , an SKPaint object do not maintain an internal stack of state. That is, there is no save/restore on a paint. However, SKPaint objects are relatively light-weight, so the client may create and maintain any number of paint objects, each set up for a particular use.

Factoring all of these color and stylistic attributes out of the canvas state, and into (multiple) paint objects, allows the save and restore operations on the to be that much more efficient, as all they have to do is maintain the stack of matrix and clip settings.
The example above produces the following:
This shows three different paints, each set up to draw in a different style. Now the caller can intermix these paints freely, either using them as is, or modifying them as the drawing proceeds.

Beyond simple attributes such as color, strokes, and text values, paints support effects. These are subclasses of different aspects of the drawing pipeline, that when referenced by a paint (each of them is reference-counted), are called to override some part of the drawing pipeline.
For example, to draw using a gradient instead of a single color, assign a SkShader to the paint.
Now, anything drawn with that paint will be drawn with the gradient specified in the call to CreateLinearGradient.
There are five types of effects that can be assigned to an object:

item.term: BlendMode - Blend modes and Duff-Porter transfer modes.
ColorFilter - Modifies the source colors before applying the BlendMode.
MaskFilter - Modification of the alpha mask before it is colorized and drawn (for example, blur)
PathEffect - Modification of the geometry (path) before the alpha mask is generated (for example, dashing)

member.name: P:SkiaSharp.SKPath.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the bounds of the path's points. If the path contains zero points/verbs, this will return the empty rectangle.
member.value: Gets the bounds of the path's points.
member.remarks: This bounds may be larger than the actual shape, since curves do not extend as far as their control points. Additionally this bound encompases all points, even isolated MoveTo either preceeding or following the last non-degenerate contour.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.Close
member.summary: Closes the current contour.
member.remarks: If the current point is not equal to the first point of the contour, a line segment is automatically added.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.ComputeTightBounds
member.summary: Computes a bounds that is conservatively "snug" around the path.
member.returns: Returns the bounds.

remarks.para: This assumes that the path will be filled.
It does not attempt to collapse away contours that are logically empty (e.g. MoveTo(x, y) + LineTo(x, y)) but will include them in the calculation.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.CreateIterator(System.Boolean)
member.param: When this is true, each contour (as defined by a new starting move command) will be completed with a close verb regardless of the contour's contents.
member.summary: Creates an iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
member.returns: Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the various elements of the path.
member.remarks: This iterator is able to clean up the path as the values are returned. If you do not desire to get verbs that have been cleaned up, use the method instead.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPath.CreateRawIterator
member.summary: Creates a raw iterator object to scan the all of the segments (lines, quadratics, cubics) of each contours in a path.
member.returns: Returns an object that can be used to iterate over the various elements of the path.
member.remarks: Unlike the method, this iterator does not clean up or normalize the values in the path. It returns the raw elements contained in the path.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPathEffect.CreateDash(System.Single[],System.Single)
member.param: The definition of the dash pattern via an even number of entries.
The offset into the intervals array. (mod the sum of all of the intervals).
member.summary: Creates a dash path effect by specifying the dash intervals.
member.returns: Returns the new , or null on error.

remarks.para: The dash pattern is defined via an array containing an even number of entries (>=2), with the even indices specifying the length of "on" intervals, and the odd indices specifying the length of "off” intervals.

For example: if the intervals = new [] { 10, 20 } and the phase = 25, then the dash pattern will be: 5 pixels off, 10 pixels on, 20 pixels off, 10 pixels on, 20 pixels off, etc. A phase of -5, 25, 55, 85, etc. would all result in the same path, because the sum of all the intervals is 30.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKPathEffect.CreateDiscrete(System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt32)
member.param: The length of the segments to break the path into.
The maximum distance to move the point away from the original path.
The randomizer seed to use.
member.summary: Creates a “jitter” path effect by chopping a path into discrete segments, and randomly displacing them.
member.returns: Returns the new , or null on error.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKShader
member.summary: Shaders specify the source color(s) for what is being drawn in the .

remarks.para: Shaders specify the source colors for what is being drawn. If a paint has no shader, then the paint's color is used. If the paint has a shader, then the shader's colors are used instead, but they are modulated by the paint's alpha.
This makes it easy to create a shader once (e.g. bitmap tiling or gradient) and then change its transparency without having to modify the original shader, only the paint's alpha needs to be modified.
Shaders are created by calling one of the static “Create” methods in the SKShader method that create a shader of the appropriate type.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKShader.CreateBitmap(SkiaSharp.SKBitmap,SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode,SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode)
member.param: The bitmap to use inside the shader.
The tiling mode to use when sampling the bitmap in the x-direction.
The tiling mode to use when sampling the bitmap in the y-direction.
member.summary: Creates a new shader that will draw with the specified bitmap.
member.returns: Returns a new , or an empty shader on error. This function never returns null.

remarks.para: If the bitmap cannot be used (has no pixels, or its dimensions exceed implementation limits) then an empty shader may be returned.
If the source bitmap’s color type is then that mask will be colorized using the color on the paint.

member.name: M:SkiaSharp.SKShader.CreateBitmap(SkiaSharp.SKBitmap,SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode,SkiaSharp.SKShaderTileMode,SkiaSharp.SKMatrix)

The tiling mode to use when sampling the bitmap in the y-direction.
The matrix to apply before applying the shader.
member.summary: Creates a new shader that will draw with the specified bitmap.
member.returns: Returns a new , or an empty shader on error. This function never returns null.

remarks.para: If the bitmap cannot be used (has no pixels, or its dimensions exceed implementation limits) then an empty shader may be returned.
If the source bitmap’s color type is then that mask will be colorized using the color on the paint.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKSurface
member.summary: Represents the backend/results of drawing to a canvas.

remarks.para: The surface represents the backend/results of drawing to a canvas. For raster drawing, the surface will be pixels, but (for example) when drawing into a PDF or canvas, the surface stores the recorded commands.
The surface always has non-zero dimensions. If there is a request for a new surface, and either of the requested dimensions are zero, then will be returned.
Once you create a surface with one of its methods, you can draw into the canvas returned by the property. Once the drawing is complete, you can retrieve an by calling the method.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKTypeface
member.summary: Represents a specific typeface and intrinsic style of a font.

remarks.para: This is used in the paint, along with optionally algorithmic settings like , , to specify how text appears when drawn (and measured).
Typeface objects are immutable, and so they can be shared between threads.

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode
member.summary: Pre-defined blend modes.

remarks.para: Porter Duff Compositing Operators - defined algebra of compositing. These operators control the results of mixing the four sub-pixel regions formed by the overlapping of graphical objects that have an alpha or pixel coverage channel/value.
Separable Blend Mode - each component of the result color is completely determined by the corresponding components of the constituent backdrop and source colors.
Non-Separable Blend Mode - considers all color components in combination as opposed to the separable ones that look at each component individually.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Clear
member.summary: No regions are enabled. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_clr.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Color
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Difference
member.summary: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Dst
member.summary: Only the destination will be present. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.DstATop
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source replaces the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-atop.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.DstIn
member.summary: Destination which overlaps the source, replaces the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-in.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.DstOut
member.summary: Destination is placed, where it falls outside of the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-out.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.DstOver
member.summary: Destination is placed over the source. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_dst-over.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Hue
member.summary: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Modulate
member.summary: Multiplies all components (= alpha and color). [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Multiply
member.summary: The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Plus
member.summary: Display the sum of the source image and destination image. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Saturation
member.summary: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color. [Non-Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value. [Separable Blend Modes]

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Src
member.summary: Only the source will be present. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.SrcATop
member.summary: Source which overlaps the destination, replaces the destination. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src-atop.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.SrcIn
member.summary: The source that overlaps the destination, replaces the destination. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src-in.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.SrcOut
member.summary: Source is placed, where it falls outside of the destination. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src-out.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.SrcOver
member.summary: Source is placed over the destination. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_src-over.svg)

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKXferMode.Xor
member.summary: The non-overlapping regions of source and destination are combined. [Porter Duff Compositing Operators] (https://drafts.fxtf.org/compositing-1/examples/PD_xor.svg)

member.name: T:SkiaSharp.SKZeroInitialized
member.summary: Whether or not the memory passed to is zero initialized

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKZeroInitialized.No
member.summary: The memory passed has not been initialized to zero, so the codec must write all zeroes to memory.

member.name: F:SkiaSharp.SKZeroInitialized.Yes
member.summary: The memory passed is zero initialized, so the codec may take advantage of this by skipping writing zeroes.
